Comprehensive example of grading with gradetools

Source: vignettes/e-comprehensive-example.Rmd
e-comprehensive-example.Rmd
library(gradetools)

For this vignette we assume that you have already familiarized yourself with the basic functionalities of gradetools (see the vignette “how-to-grade-with-gradetools”). assist_grading() and assist_team_grading() are essentially wrappers for assist_advanced_grading(), so all functionalities available in those functions are also available in this function.

The purpose of this vignette is to provide a different grading scenario which involves:

  • Project instead of homework or quiz
  • Team grading
  • Assignments on Github
  • Multiple files per submission
  • Pushing issues and feedback to GitHub

Cloning project repos

This vignette uses two GitHub repositories (repos) from the gradetools-test-course Github organization:

  • final-project-team-poisson for one team submission.
  • final-project-team-gamma for the second team submission.

Creating issues and grading assignments

This vignette assumes knowledge on how to grade with gradetools. We will note an issue on one submission and skip grading the rest of the submissions.

Credits

The extended functionalities for assignments managed using GitHub were possible thanks to the functions in the ghclass package.

The final project submissions were made from the GitHub repository template accompanying “The 5Ws and 1H of Term Projects in the Introductory Data Science Classroom” by Çetinkaya-Rundel, Dogucu, and Rummerfield (2022).
